required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Efficacy and Safety Trial of Intravenous Zoledronic Acid Twice Yearly in Osteoporotic Children Treated With Glucocorticoids
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled Efficacy and Safety Trial of Intravenous Zoledronic Acid Twice Yearly Compared to Placebo in Osteoporotic Children Treated With Glucocorticoids.

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of zoledronic acid compared to placebo in osteoporotic children treated with glucocorticoids

detailed_description.textblock: In March 2017, Novartis stopped enrollment as the study was not feasible to be conducted due to low enrollment and other recruitment challenges. Patients receiving the treatment continued to receive the treatment per protocol.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score was determined by the central imaging vendor before first treatment and at Month 12. The methods to be used to measure Lumbar Spine BMD Z-score were described in the respective DXA Manuals provided by central imaging vendor. Positive changes from baseline indicated an improvement in condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score was determined by the central imaging vendor before first treatment and at Month 6. The methods to be used to measure Lumbar Spine BMD Z-score were described in the respective DXA Manuals provided by central imaging vendor. Positive changes from baseline indicated an improvement in condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine BMC at Month 6 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Lumbar Spine BMC was determined by the central imaging vendor before first treatment and at Months 6 and 12. The methods to be used to measure BMC were described in the respective DXA Manuals.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Body BMC at Month 6 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Total body BMC was all determined by the central imaging vendor before first treatment and at Months 6 and 12. The methods to be used to measure BMC were described in the respective DXA Manuals.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Serum P1NP at Months 6 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Serum Procollagen type 1 amino-terminal propeptide (P1NP) was collected before first treatment (baseline) and at Months 6 and Month 12 according to the instructions provided in the Laboratory Manual. The samples were analyzed in batches at the laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in BSAP at Months 6 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Bone specific alkaline phosphatase (BSAP) were collected before first treatment (baseline) and at Months 6 and Month 12 according to the instructions provided in the Laboratory Manual. The samples were analyzed in batches at the laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Serum NTX at Months 6 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Serum Cross linked N-telopeptide (NTX) were collected before first treatment (baseline) and at Months 6 and Month 12 according to the instructions provided in the Laboratory Manual. The samples were analyzed in batches at the laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Serum TRAP-5b at Months 6 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Serum Tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase isoform 5b (TRAP 5b) was collected before first treatment (baseline) and at Months 6 and Month 12 according to the instructions provided in the Laboratory Manual. The samples were analyzed in batches at the laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With New Vertebral Fractures at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: New vertebral fractures were defined as fractures of Genant Grade 1 or higher that occurred at lumbar or thoracic spine from first dose infusion to the end of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Vertebral Morphometry at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Vertebral morphometry (or concave index) was calculated using the average ratio between mid-height and posterior height from L1 to L4 and performed by a central reader.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Reduction in Pain at Months 3, 6, 9 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Pain was evaluated at each visit (in office and telephone visit) at randomization, Months 3, 6, 9 and 12 using the Faces Pain Scale-Revised (FPS-R). Children were selecting the face that best fits their pain. The pain score ranged from 0 (No Pain) to 10 (Very Much Pain). The reduction in pain from baseline by visit was evaluated based on whether or not patients had a decrease in their FPS-R from baseline. If pain remained the same or worsened from baseline a patient was classified as '0' and if the pain scale decreased then the patient was classified as '1'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in 2nd Metacarpal Cortical Width at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Left posteroanterior (PA) hand/wrist X-ray were taken at Visit 1 and at the Month 12 visit to assess bone age and the between-treatment differences for change in 2nd metacarpal cortical width at Month 12 relative to baseline. If a fracture of the left upper extremity precluded radiographic imaging, then the right hand was evaluated for this purpose. In this case, the right hand was be imaged at both Visit 1 and at Month 12. The information was used in the assessment of bone density.

secondary_outcome.measure: Urinary Concentration of Zoledronic Acid at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Urine was collected overnight or for at least 4 waking hours from all patients able to provide specimens, to measure urinary concentration of zoledronic acid at Month 12. Only descriptive analysis done.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of Zoledronic Acid for the Treatment of Osteoporotic Children Treated With Glucocorticoids
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of absolute and relative frequencies for treatment emergent Adverse Event (AE), Serious Adverse Event (SAE) and Deaths by primary System Organ Class (SOC) to demonstrate that zoledronic acid is safe for the treatment of osteoporotic children treated with glucocorticoids through the monitoring of relevant clinical and laboratory safety parameters. Only descriptive analysis done.

arm_group.description: Twice yearly 0.05 mg/kg (max 5 mg) i.v infusion (at least 30 minutes) of zoledronic acid
Twice yearly i.v of infusion of Placebo (similar dosing as active drug)

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of chronic rheumatologic conditions or inflammatory bowel disease or Duchenne muscular dystrophy requiring systemic glucocorticoids (i.v. or oral) within 12 months prior to screening
- Lumbar Spine BMDZ-score of -0.5 or worse
- Evidence of at least at least 1 vertebral compression fracture of Genant Grade 1 or higher (or radiographic signs of vertebral fracture) within 1 month from Screening visit OR One or more, low-trauma, lower extremity long-bone fracture which occurred sometime within the 2 years PRECEDING enrollment in the study OR Two or more, low-trauma, upper extremity long-bone fractures which occurred sometime within the 2 years PRECEDING enrollment in the study
- Consent/assent to study participation
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- History of primary bone disease (OI, Idiopathic Juvenile Osteoporosis, Rickets/Osteomalacia)
- Any medical condition that might have interfered with the evaluation of lumbar spine BMD, such as severe scoliosis or spinal fusion. Patients with less than 3 evaluable vertebrae by Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DXA) evaluation in the region of interest lumbar 1 (L1) to lumbar 4 (L4),
- Hypocalcemia and hypophosphatemia
- Serum 25-hydroxy vitamin D concentrations of <20 ng/mL or <50 nmol/L
- estimated glomerular filtration rate (GFR) <60 mL/min/1.73 m2
- serum creatinine increase between Visit 1 and Visit 2 >0.5 mg/dL (44.2 μmol/L)
- Uncontrolled symptoms of cardiac failure or arrhythmia
- Any prior use of bisphosphonates, or high dose sodium fluoride

clinical_study.keyword: Osteoporosis, children and adolescents, zoledronic acid, chronic inflammation, Duchenne muscular dystrophy, glucocorticoids, chronic inflammatory conditions

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted in 12 centers in 6 countries: Australia (1), Canada (5), Hungary (1), United Kingdom (2), Russian Federation (2), and South Africa (1).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The Participant Flow and Baseline Characteristics were done on the Intention-to-treat (ITT) population. All efficacy analyses were done on the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population and all safety analyses were based on Safety population.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Twice yearly 0.05 mg/kg (max 5 mg) i.v infusion (at least 30 minutes) of zoledronic acid

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Twice yearly i.v of infusion of Placebo (similar dosing as active drug)

baseline.population: The Participant Flow and Demographics (age/gender/race) were done on the Intention-to-treat (IIT) population whereas the Baseline disease characteristics were on the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT). All efficacy analyses were done on the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population and all safety analyses were based on Safety population.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Twice yearly 0.05 mg/kg (max 5 mg) i.v infusion (at least 30 minutes) of zoledronic acid

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Twice yearly i.v of infusion of Placebo (similar dosing as active drug)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score
measure.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. No imputation done at Baseline. Bone mass, as measured by DXA, is reported as BMC (g) or areal BMD (g/cm2). These values are compared with reference values from healthy youth of similar age, sex, and race/ ethnicity to calculate a z score, the number of SDs from the expected mean. A BMC or BMD z score that is >2 SDs below expected (< –2.0) is referred to as “low for age".
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Content (BMC)
measure.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Content (BMC) in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. No imputation done at Baseline.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Total body Bone Mineral Content (BMC)
measure.description: Total body Bone Mineral Content (BMC) in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. No imputation done at Baseline.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Serum Procollagen type 1 amino-terminal propeptide (P1NP)
measure.description: Serum Procollagen type 1 amino-terminal propeptide (P1NP) in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. No imputation done at Baseline.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Serum Bone specific alkaline phosphatase (BSAP)
measure.description: Serum Bone specific alkaline phosphatase (BSAP) in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. No imputation done at Baseline.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Serum Cross linked N-telopeptide (NTX)
measure.description: Serum Cross linked N-telopeptide (NTX) in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. No imputation done at Baseline.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Serum Tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase isoform 5b (TRAP-5b)
measure.description: Serum Tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase isoform 5b (TRAP-5b) in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. No imputation done at Baseline.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Vertebral Morphometry (mid-to-posterior height ratio)
measure.description: Vertebral Morphometry (mid-to-posterior height ratio) in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. Calculation was done using average ratio between mid-height and posterior height from L1 to L4 and analysis of covariance model was used with treatment, pooled centers, underlying condition treated with glucocordicoids and baseline value as explanatory variables and pooled centers as random effect.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

measure.title: Second metacarpal cortical width
measure.description: Second metacarpal cortical width in the Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population. Metacarpal cortical width of "0" was not included. An analysis of covariance model used with treatment, pooled centers, underlying condition treated with glucocorticoids at baseline value as explanatory variables and pooled centers as random effect.
measure.population: Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population = All patients with baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score at Month 12
outcome.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Z-score was determined by the central imaging vendor before first treatment and at Month 12. The methods to be used to measure Lumbar Spine BMD Z-score were described in the respective DXA Manuals provided by central imaging vendor. Positive changes from baseline indicated an improvement in condition.
outcome.population: The Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population, which consisted of all randomized patients who had both baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score, was considered.

outcome.description: Pain was evaluated at each visit (in office and telephone visit) at randomization, Months 3, 6, 9 and 12 using the Faces Pain Scale-Revised (FPS-R). Children were selecting the face that best fits their pain. The pain score ranged from 0 (No Pain) to 10 (Very Much Pain). The reduction in pain from baseline by visit was evaluated based on whether or not patients had a decrease in their FPS-R from baseline. If pain remained the same or worsened from baseline a patient was classified as '0' and if the pain scale decreased then the patient was classified as '1'.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Reduction in Pain at Months 3, 6, 9 and 12
measure.description: Pain was evaluated at each visit (in office and telephone visit) at randomization, Months 3, 6, 9 and 12 using the Faces Pain Scale-Revised (FPS-R). The reduction in pain from baseline by visit was evaluated based on whether or not patients had a decrease in their FPS-R from baseline. measure.population: The Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population, which consisted of all randomized patients who had both baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score, was considered.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Presented by treatment group and evaluated using a logistic regression model with treatment, pooled centers, underlying condition treated with glucocorticoids and baseline pain score as explanatory variables.

Presented by treatment group and evaluated using a logistic regression model with treatment, pooled centers, underlying condition treated with glucocorticoids and baseline pain score as explanatory variables.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in 2nd Metacarpal Cortical Width at Month 12
outcome.description: Left posteroanterior (PA) hand/wrist X-ray were taken at Visit 1 and at the Month 12 visit to assess bone age and the between-treatment differences for change in 2nd metacarpal cortical width at Month 12 relative to baseline. If a fracture of the left upper extremity precluded radiographic imaging, then the right hand was evaluated for this purpose. In this case, the right hand was be imaged at both Visit 1 and at Month 12. The information was used in the assessment of bone density.
outcome.population: The Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population, which consisted of all randomized patients who had both baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score, was considered.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Twice yearly 0.05 mg/kg (max 5 mg) i.v infusion (at least 30 minutes) of zoledronic acid

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Twice yearly i.v of infusion of Placebo (similar dosing as active drug)

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in 2nd Metacarpal Cortical Width at Month 12
measure.description: Left posteroanterior (PA) hand/wrist X-ray were taken at Visit 1 and at the Month 12 visit to assess bone age and the between-treatment differences for change in 2nd metacarpal cortical width at Month 12 relative to baseline. If a fracture of the left upper extremity precluded radiographic imaging, then the right hand was evaluated for this purpose. In this case, the right hand was be imaged at both Visit 1 and at Month 12. The information was used in the assessment of bone density.
measure.population: The Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population, which consisted of all randomized patients who had both baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score, was considered.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Difference in least squares (LS) = LS mean for the zoledronic acid group—LS mean for the placebo group.

outcome.title: Urinary Concentration of Zoledronic Acid at Month 12
outcome.description: Urine was collected overnight or for at least 4 waking hours from all patients able to provide specimens, to measure urinary concentration of zoledronic acid at Month 12. Only descriptive analysis done.
outcome.population: The Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population, which consisted of all randomized patients who had both baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score, was considered.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Twice yearly 0.05 mg/kg (max 5 mg) i.v infusion (at least 30 minutes) of zoledronic acid

measure.title: Urinary Concentration of Zoledronic Acid at Month 12
measure.description: Urine was collected overnight or for at least 4 waking hours from all patients able to provide specimens, to measure urinary concentration of zoledronic acid at Month 12. Only descriptive analysis done.
measure.population: The Modified Intention-to-treat (MITT) population, which consisted of all randomized patients who had both baseline and at least one post-baseline lumbar spine BMD Z-score, was considered.

outcome.title: Safety of Zoledronic Acid for the Treatment of Osteoporotic Children Treated With Glucocorticoids
outcome.description: Analysis of absolute and relative frequencies for treatment emergent Adverse Event (AE), Serious Adverse Event (SAE) and Deaths by primary System Organ Class (SOC) to demonstrate that zoledronic acid is safe for the treatment of osteoporotic children treated with glucocorticoids through the monitoring of relevant clinical and laboratory safety parameters. Only descriptive analysis done.
outcome.population: The Safety population, which consisted of all patients who had been exposed to at least one infusion of study drug, was considered.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Twice yearly 0.05 mg/kg (max 5 mg) i.v infusion (at least 30 minutes) of zoledronic acid

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Twice yearly i.v of infusion of Placebo (similar dosing as active drug)

SAEs by Primary System Organ Class (SOC)
Deaths by Primary System Organ Class (SOC)

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) are collected from First Patient First Visit (FPFV) until Last Patient Last Visit (LPLV). All AEs reported in this record are from date of First Patient First Treatment until Last Patient Last Visit) up to approximately 9 years and 3 months.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Twice yearly 0.05 mg/kg (max 5 mg) i.v infusion (at least 30 minutes) of zoledronic acid

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Twice yearly i.v of infusion of Placebo (similar dosing as active drug)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
